text: Altkirch is a commune in Alsace in north-eastern France, in the Haut-Rhin department, of which it is a subprefecture. It is in the Grand Est region. Its name comes from the German Alte Kirche ("old church"). ==Geography== Altkirch is in the south of the Haut-Rhin department. The Ill river, a left tributary of the Rhine river, flows through the commune. It has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Altkirch to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Strasbourg, the regional capital - ; * Marseille - ; * Lyon - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Nice - . Altkirch and its neighboring communes The commune of Altkirch is surrounded by the communes: ===Climate=== The climate of Altkirch, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Altkirch are known, in French, as Altkirchois (women: Altkirchoises). With a population of 5,738, Altkirch has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is the capital of the Altkirch arrondissement and is also the administrative centre () of the canton of Altkirch formed by 64 communes, with 47,552 inhabitants (2014). === Twin towns === Altkirch is twinned with: * Le Thor, France, since 1991 * San Daniele del Friuli, Italy, since 1994 * Füzuli, Azerbaijan, since 2016 ==Gallery== File:Altkirch.jpg|Aerial view of Altkirch. File:Altkirch, Temple protestant.jpg|Protestant temple of Altkirch. ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Altkirch * Communes of the Haut-Rhin department ==References== ==Other websites== * Ville d' Altkirch - Official site Category:Communes in Haut-Rhin Category:Subprefectures in France
